Early Access Review

After playing this game through in about 3 hours time I decided to adjust my review. Yes I think the game lacks content, yes I think the game has more potential, but I still really like this game.

This game is awesome. The mechanics are great, the ambiance is great, the items are great. It is really that kind of authentic adventure game that is so rare nowadays. Just searching through a dungeon searching for items and enemies without complicated gameplay mechanics to learn.

I also like that you keep your gold when you die. This way even when you suck at this game, you can get somewhere after trying some times by buying a bow and some arrows in the store.

Early Access Review

Day 1

I went around to look at the interesting textures 2D everything reminds me of Paper Mario. The merchant looks at me funny and the people seem not to be able to look at me. I get the candle from the merchant and enter the dungeon, I soon stumble upon some zombies. Low on health i try to run out the dungeon in hopes of getting healed, little did I know the shop keeper locked me in...

Day 2
I head to the next dungeon slowly gathering armor and weapons. I get a broadsword and a few magical sticks lucky me. Then a hobo hops on me several times before i stab him with my new butter sword. I then loot the hobo's bum and then I am attacked by my psychotic ex-batgirl. I then enter the next dungeon.

Day 3
I am testing out potions because some idiot dropped a bunch of edible food on the floor. Sadly, it was on the floor for some time but I can't be picky.

Day 4
I made it to the caverns!

Day XX
I have lost count of the days... DAYS! So... litttle food... *cough*. Oh god, the magical octopus is coming for me! If you get this please, tell my ex she's a b*****

Day 1
Ah sh** I am back to start -.-



And that concludes my review

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a great game, super fun, easy to pick up and play, but unforgiving if you aren't careful :D. Two things would make this game even better co-op multiplayer and a quick switch key for wielded items. Please buy this game and ask for the same!

Early Access Review

I seem to be playing a lot of Roguelikes recently, and this game is pretty darn good for Early Access.

Your mission is to explore the dungeon and find the orb at the bottommost floor, fighting through groups of people, bugs (ick), bats and skeletons. Get the orb and do your best to escape alive, because everything comes back at you threefold once you pick up the darn thing. The first-person perspective, coupled with a few small corridors and narrow walkways, really give you a mild sense of fear and excitement--you never know what's going to jump out from behind the wall (hopefully not a magic-user).

The game is pretty short. For some players, you could run through the whole thing and escape alive in only about 3 attempts. But don't let that deter you, as it is a lot of fun regardless. That being said, I would strongly suggest picking this game up when it's on sale, as there is a lot to be desired. Still, it IS Early Access...

Also, sometimes I feel like I'm being cheated. I went down there with around 80 arrows, never found a bow, found the orb instead, tried to escape, made it back up to the first floor and FINALLY found a single bow to use the arrows with. Great...
Early Access Review\n\nI absolutely love this game, I can spend hours on end playing through it.
Early Access Review\n\nIt's a throwback to when video games weren't triple A and everybody bought them anyway.

Early Access Review\n\nBrilliant - the production values may not be up to much but I really felt a sense of progression, and although there is the (constant) need to restart on death there's enough variability in layout, and equipment to keep it interesting.
Early Access Review\n\nA neat third person roguelike. It doesn't have the customization I enjoy in Roguelikes, such as class and race choice, but its a fun little timewaster.

Early Access Review\n\nThis game is worth 8 dollars. But however it has some bugs that cam somtimes be annoying and maybe add some more areas. Also maybe add a hardmode where enemies do twice the damage. Overall this game is worth every penny! 9/10

Early Access Review\n\nThis game has potential.  One the many aspects of dungeon delving games is getting to sell tons of loot that you collect.  Right now there is no sell function.  This a huge downer for me in a game.  Otherwise, the gameplay is fun and everything seems to run well.

Early Access Review

Going into the game, I was put off at first by the simplicity of it. I thought there wouldn't be a way this game could be enagging for more than a couple hours. Oh, how I was wrong. This game is very very fun, and the sense of excitement I get when making it back to the surface is as fresh as the first time I made it. That being said, it's a rougelike, so don't expect to make it out often unless you prepare yourself and manage your inventory.

It's a great game with a bright future and I can't wait to see what else the developers do!

Early Access Review\n\nIt's a lot  like FTL: Short, but very addictive, insanely hard and very easy to die, but your failed runs can still help your next run, and when you think you finally made it to the end, there's a surprise finale you didn't prepare for. I really do like how the RNG traps and potions can be identified without you having to test them on yourself.  Also, poison will bring you to 1 health, but it won't kill you. Just thought you should know.

7/10

Early Access Review\n\nThis is quite a good game for something that is in beta. It is always frustrating to get a good item and then die because of one of those stupid bats. The best weapon I have found is a excellent iron mace or was it a excellent steel mace? It is good that the game gets updates regularly unlike some games. It is a good game and I think you should buy it while it's cheap.

Early Access Review\n\nA surprisinlgy fun little first person dungeon crawler. The graphics are very minimalistic and pixely but I actually like that stlye. Dungeons are random everytime and the monsters and enemies all behave differently and have unique skills and weapons. Fighting feels fun and fast paced. The levels look great and are very athmospheric. This game is still in development so I'm looking forward to more content. Get it if you like rogue-likes.
Early Access Review\n\nA great game. Near perfect fp dungeoncrawl action. Would love to see co-op at some point though. That would be incredible! Good soundtrack too.

Early Access Review

I'm a bit mixed with this one.  Do I like it?  Yes.  Would I recommend it?  Yes and no.
I didn't get to experience the 'rogue-like' elements of this game.  On my very first play through I beat it in under 2 hours.  That is to say - I did not die once.  So there was no loss of equipment and items.

To me it's a nice past time dungeon crawler / Rogue-like.  Get in, mix it up, and get out.

I recommend it if you enjoy the dungeon crawling crunchy pixel" atmosphere.

I do not recommend it if you are a hard core rogue-like fan - this game will not challenge you

hoursPlayed: you can't see far ahead of you even with a decent light source.  Makes you feel boxed in.  And it does nothing at all to add to the element of surprise from the creatures attacking you.  Ultimately I ditched the light source the moment I could and picked up a shield.\n\nIt's too predictable.  Seen 'em once?  Yeah

Early Access Review

What a fantastic game! For a game that is supposed to be under construction, it feels remarkably complete!

My only complaints? Switching what's in your offhand is cumbersome--I'd love a way to quickly switch from candle to buckler and back--and the mini map is essentially useless. Also, I'd love a slightly bigger combat belt. Even one more slot would make a world of difference. Thanks for such a fantastic game! I look forward to future updates!

Early Access Review

for what it is, its really good.
theres a lot of places that it can go- i mean obviously its gone most of the way, but theres still a lot more that can be done with it- and im looking forward to seeing where exactly that is
its been worth the cost even though i havent put that much time into it, though the only drawback is that at times it starts to get repetitive but thats what most of the progress seems to be focused on fixing

its good now, but i can only see it reasonably getting better (considering what it is and everything, i mean you cant fairly compare it to a lot of much *larger* more serious games, though it does have a kind of seriousness to it- not a very serious seriousness though)

and dying actually gets the response it should which is good

so yeah thumbs up

Early Access Review

Delver is an awesome game where you go down multiple levels to find the ultimate treasure.
On your way to it you encounter countless enemies and attempt to ward them off.
one of my most favorite weapon in the game is the Hammer because you can break down doors with them

so my rating is 9.9 stars out of 10.0 (the decimals count)
so in this Witch of space's opinion i think that anyone looking for a game with Zelda-like textures and hammers or wands or shortswords or swords or daggers ect GO BUY DELVER....
you won't regret it
